name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Magic: The Gathering with ReRoll Board Games
description: After many years of talking about this, we’re finally starting a Magic: The Gathering meetup. If you are curious about this massively popular card game, or are already a player looking to find others to play with in-person, this is for you!For people who’ve never played before:This is designed for new players to explore the game. We’ll teach you the rules, and will pair up new players with each other. We’ll be playing the with 40-card decks, using the Jumpstart 2022 set - which is a great way to learn the game without too much time on deck building.For experienced playersWe have a few premade standard (60 card) decks to play, as well a few commander decks.This is a light, friendly environment for players to explore the game and meet the community - it is not a competitive event. Be helpful, and expect people to make mistakes.

name: Dialogues with Books: A Mystery Awaits
description: Dialogues with Books Monthly Meetup: A Mystery AwaitsThis month, DWB is diving into the shadows for a genre-specific gathering that’s all about Mystery!Whether you're into classic whodunits, psychological thrillers, cozy mysteries, or gritty noir, we’re shining the spotlight on all things enigmatic. From iconic authors like Conan Doyle, Agatha Christie and Raymond Chandler to modern masters like Tana French, Jane Harper and Gillian Flynn- this meetup is for the curious, the clue-hunters, and the plot-twist lovers.Bring your favourite mystery book, a recommendation, or just your sleuthing spirit. Let’s crack open some secrets together. 🔎What is Dialogues with Books: DWB is one of Bangalore's much loved book communities. With a thriving online community and engaging monthly meetups/events, we have over the years carefully created a close knit group of bibliophiles and enthusiastic readers.We meet up regularly on the third Sunday of every month.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Bangalore Puzzle Pals with Playful Pursuits
description: When was the last time you put a jigsaw puzzle together? Puzzles are for everyone! It doesn’t matter if you loved puzzles as a kid, enjoy them now, or want to pick up a new hobby; if you do them solo or with friends and family; whether you like to take your time or prefer to blitz them - Bangalore Puzzle Pals is for you.Join us to enjoy a relaxed off-screen evening in a social setting while you put together beautiful images, solve puzzles from new and exciting brands, and get a little competitive with some speed puzzling or puzzle chess! You’re also welcome to bring your own puzzles either to solve or sell/swap with others.Come alone, with a partner, with friends or family! We will have something for everyone. (Under-18s may attend if accompanied by an adult.)Who is Playful Pursuits?We are Bangalore’s first jigsaw puzzle meetup group, providing a space for puzzle enthusiasts to come together to solve jigsaws, swap and sell their puzzles, and compete in speed puzzling! We meet in-person every Monday and on the occasional weekend.You can follow us on Instagram at @playful.pursuits and join our WhatsApp group.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

name: Leela by Sanjay Divecha (Live) at Sabha BLR
description: Sanjay Divecha is one of the most revered guitar players in India. A unique and compelling voice as a player and composer, he is part of the hugely successful supergroup Cross Currents led by Zakir Hussain and featuring stalwarts such as Dave Holland, Vinnie Colaiuta, Chris Potter, Eddie Daniels, Shankar Mahadevan and Louiz Banks. Through a luminous 35 year long career, Sanjay has worked with artists such as Angelique Kidjo, Carlos Santana, Michael McDonald, Fred Raulston, Dave Weckl, Louis Johnson, Dumazz and Sambaguru among others.He also collaborated with A.R. Rahman on the Danny Boyle movie “127 Hours” that won ‘Best Original Score’, the OST for the movie “Woman on Top” with Argentinian composer Luis Bacalov, Sanjay also scored for the movie ‘Leela’ by Somnath Sen which won a Special Jury Award at Toronto Reel World Film Festival.An alumnus (1989) from Musician’s Institute (M.I) in Los Angeles, Sanjay continues to mentor and develop musicians all over the country. His students are not only guitar players, but composers, musicians and singers of all disciplines. Sanjay teaches private lessons and holds workshops to develop musicality and a well rounded aesthetic sensibility in musicians. Sanjay Divecha on the music of 'Leela' :" As a human being on this planet I’ve always believed in the Oneness of all things in this universe. Going through life's bylanes and observing how events unfold and teach you the lessons to be learned, this belief of Oneness has only strengthened with time. My work as an artist has primarily been to connect with my inner self, and express from a place of honesty. The yearning to learn something new in my art and refine my skill set has been my constant companion. After having written and performed music with various ensembles, I finally mustered up the courage to record a collection of music which was mainly written for solo guitar, and also mainly recorded on acoustic guitar. These songs are reflections of some of my journeys and inspirations, interpreted in a spontaneous and instinctive manner. The title 'Leela' refers to the divine Leela - joyous and playful - yet a profound act of creation. As I started the recording process I started to add a few layers to enhance the music and some guest artists came on board to complete the experience which was truly fulfilling for me as an artist. The organic nature of this work takes me back to my formative years as a guitar player and I’m grateful to be sharing this work and for it to take its own journey. "SEATING ON FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BASIS

name: Whimsical Wednesday with Improv Lore
description: Dive into the whimsical world of improvisation at our Wednesday Jams!Whether you’re a novice to theatre, a maverick on stage, or just dipping your toes into the world of unscripted performance, this Jam is designed for everyone. Our facilitators will guide you through a series of engaging improv exercises, help you explore new characters, and set up scenarios that will make your inner wit shine - all on the spot!Come as you are, leave your inhibitions at the door, and join us on this journey of endless possibility.Bring a friend, a date, or a group - our brave space is for everyone!Who are Improv Lore?We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.You can follow us on Instagram at @improvlore and join our WhatsApp community.

name: Creative Writing Workshop
description: This is a personalized, one-on-one writing workshop designed for those who want to reconnect with their writing in a focused, supportive space. The workshop is structured in three parts:Part 1: Prompt-Based Self-Reflection: We`ll begin with a guided reflection exercise using carefully chosen prompts. This part helps you explore personal thoughts, emotions, and experiences through writing—an excellent practice for journaling, memoir, or emotional clarity.Part 2: Creative Fiction Exercise: In the second half, you`ll be given an on-the-spot creative writing prompt to develop a short fictional piece. This encourages spontaneity, imagination, and narrative flow.Part 3: Understanding Yourself Better Using The 2 Writing ExercisesWe conclude by collecting our thoughts and discussing what you have learnt about yourself and about each other through our pieces in the workshop. You can write in any language you`re comfortable with. This format allows for flexible pacing, open conversation, and tailored feedback (if desired).Whether you`re looking to jumpstart your writing practice, process personal experiences, or simply enjoy a quiet hours of creativity, this one-on-one session is designed to meet you where you are—no pressure, just honest expression and guided structure.About the host : Swathi is a Berlin based writer who writes short fiction in different genres. She conducts creative writing workshops that help people process various emotions through self reflection pieces and overcome writer’s block by building a fictional world in a limited time. You can follow her on Instagram @swathispeaks or read her work on Medium.

name: Hello, “Thirsty Crow”! - at Sabha, BLR
description: Hello, Thirsty Crow!Puppet Show, Art Session and some Fun-Time! For Children aged 2-6 Years (and anyone who loves puppetry) 📍 Venue: Sabha, Kamaraj Road, Shivajinagar, BLR📅 Date: Sunday, July 13th, 2025⏰ Time: 11:00 AM to 12:30 PM🎟️ Tickets — pre-registration is a must!About The SessionWatch a modern take on the classic Panchatantra Story, “The Thirsty Crow” – with a handmade puppet! In a mini-theatrical setting, the imagination goes on a ride with songs, edutainment and a moral for a lifetime! Discover the magic of puppet-making as you dive into the creative process and learn how to bring your puppet to life!Meet The PuppeteerArt. Story. Repeat!Seeming like a traditional Virtual Reality (VR), Aditi is amused by this loop - Art creates a character and the Story is your imagination - endless possibilities!Starting her career as a UX/UI/Graphic Design IT professional in Bengaluru, she now pursues her childhood passion of bead art and puppetry - band of beads.About The VenueSabha is imagined as a cultural space housed in a meticulously restored 160-year-old CVS Sabha school, part of the RBANM's Educational Charities legacy. Envisioned as a hub for the arts, ideas, and community, Sabha is a place where heritage meets contemporary expression.

name: Madhuragati: An Odissi Dance Performance
description: Madhuragati - Every step in Odissi resounds with the sweetness of a cultural aesthetic formed over centuries of aspiration for a higher goal.. To celebrate the beauty of this exquisite dance form arising from the life and beliefs of the people of forgone times till now. Anoushka will perform dance works that showcase a range of possibilities highlighting the sculptural and expressive qualities of the Odissi style.The performance features five pieces, seamlessly connected by brief introductory interludes. This carefully crafted format offers an engaging experience for the audience, guiding them through the beauty of the Odissi classical dance form. Originally a sacred ritual dedicated to the gods, Odissi is one of the oldest dance traditions in the world. Odissi speaks of love and union, between the human and divine, transporting viewers to enchanted worlds of magic and spirituality. Its sensuous and lyrical grace reflects both the motifs of Odisha temple sculpture as well as the poetry from the deep wellsprings of Odia music.Anoushka Rahman, disciple of Guru Surupa Sen, is the new soloist and emerging star of The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.She started her Odissi journey with Smt.Dona Ganguly in Kolkata and holds a Sangeet Bhaskar in Odissi dance and a postgraduate degree in Mathematics.Her association with Nrityagram began in 2018 through a Summer Workshop, which paved the way for advanced training under the guidance of Surupa Sen and Pavithra Reddy. Recognised for her talent and dedication, she was awarded the Virendra Kumar Laroia Fellowship. She has performed with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble across India, the US, Canada and Sri Lanka and was presented in a solo debut performance in November 2024. At present, Anoushka is a dancer with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.ChoreographyGuru Kelucharan Mohapatra (Sun Maiyyā)Surupa SenMusic CompositionPt. Raghunath PanigrahiPt. Bhubaneswar Mishra (Sakhī Hé)Ashit Desai (Sun Maiyyā)Technical Director & Lighting DesignerLynne FernandezNrityagramwww.nrityagram.orglynne@nrityagram.orgVenue: SABHA Blr, 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042

name: Ladies Lounge Brunch Bangalore
description: THIS IS A SAPPHIC/FEMME/WOMEN ONLY EVENT Ladies Lounge is a brunch event for sapphic individuals to meet and network in a safe environment. The event embraces women and sapphic non-binary individuals (21+) from diverse backgrounds and sexual orientations. You can come to chill and connect with others who share similar interests, bodies and pleasure.What we expect from you:- You follow the rules of consent - You are respectful to people across all genders, sexualities and lifestyle choices- Dress to express femininity Vetting and Payments:-Only those who pass the vetting calls will be allowed to attend our events- If you bring a friend you will get 10% off ticket price. The more friends the more discounts -Once you pass the the vetting call you will be offered a TIC Events membership which if you choose to take, will grant you a discount of 25 % off on all future online and offline events for the next 12 months-If you choose to not take the membership, you can pay the ticket amount and confirm your slot to the event-If you fail the vetting process you will need to take our sex and gender masterclass and pass a written test to gain the membership and attend the eventWe are doing this to ensure that the spaces TIC creates are completely safe for everyone. We also get a lot of responses from people for our events and end up spending a good amount of time vetting people who may or may not attend the event if they pass the vetting. The above process makes sure that we are compensated for our time and that you are serious about attending the event.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. name: where you from: A Theatrical Poetry Experience
description: For ages 16 and abovewhere you from:So tell me, where are you from, now that you're here?Are you from earth's kernels, or a childhood lane?Are you from a summer of love, or your innate politics?Are you from where they say you're from, or have you yet to find out?Where You From?About the show:This genre-defining show offers glimpses into the changing identities of a body in continued performance. Bringing cliff notes from a decade-long practice in creating works of words, Nupur Azadi - a slam poet who emerged from Singapore - shows what is possible when meditations in movement, voicework, spoken word, and theatrical traditions come together.-65-minute, devised-solo told in fours acts, without intermission.-Multi-disciplinary and multi-media show suitable for audiences 16+.-This show is part of the A Decade of Theatrical Poetry celebration and was first shown during BLR Hubba in December 2024. It was followed by Jagriti Theatre in February 2025 and Sabha BLR in June 2025. About the artist:Nupur Azadi (she/her) is an international stage artist who creates works of words. She is a self-taught, multi-disciplinary artist who emerged from the close-knit slam poetry spaces of Singapore in 2015. Her work has been hailed as ‘urgent’ and ‘engaging’ by a global audience. In 2022 she conceptualized, wrote, produced, directed, and performed in a one-woman theatrical poetry show called ‘Live. Love. Loaf. An investigation into who gets to loiter’. Over 2022 and 2023 she performed the same across various venues in Bangalore and NALSAR, Hyderabad before taking it to Singapore and Cambodia. As a student of Voicework, and of literary pedagogies, and a continued participant in movement arts learnings, she labors over foraging a physicality to the previously textual genre of spoken word. She intertwines spoken word, theatre, music, and movement into an art form she christened Theatrical Poetry.Read reviews: "When Nupur speaks, you listen. What a performance!" -Vasu Dixit "Met so many women and their stories in one tonight" - Sal Yusuf"Found a whole new genre in this show." - Damini Gairola"Azadi at her courageous best!" - Dipankar Panth

name: Breathwork with Kavya
description: Breathe Into Balance: From Regulation to TransformationWith Kavya Peerbhoy, Breathwork Facilitator with Ujjayi Movement StudioJoin us for a transformative evening of breath-led healing at The Studio by Copper & Cloves. This immersive worskshop is designed to help you drop out of your busy mind, reconnect with your body, and access deep emotional release and inner clarity through the power of your breath.Workshop Flow•⁠ ⁠Welcome & Introductions•⁠ ⁠Parasympathetic Nervous System Activation •⁠ ⁠Conscious Connected Breathwork Journey •⁠ ⁠Deep Relaxation•⁠ ⁠Sharing Circle with Herbal tea and with light plant-based snacksWhat You Can Expect•⁠ ⁠A safe space to explore your breath•⁠ ⁠Emotional release and nervous system regulation•⁠ ⁠A sense of deep calm, clarity, and groundedness•⁠ ⁠Community connection through shared practice and conversationLongterm Benefits of Breathwork:•⁠ ⁠Nervous system regulation•⁠ ⁠Improved lung capacity and breath awareness•⁠ ⁠Enhanced focus, emotional resilience, and sleep quality•⁠ ⁠Anxiety and stress reduction•⁠ ⁠High vagal tone and restored energy levels•⁠ ⁠Access to non-ordinary states of consciousness•⁠ ⁠Process suppressed emotions and trauma•⁠ ⁠Enhanced self-awareness, intuition, and creativity•⁠ ⁠Release tension and stagnant energy stored in the body•⁠ ⁠Creates space for clarity, insights, and healingAbout our Breathwork Facilitator: Kavya Peerbhoy After spending over two decades leading global marketing teams across some of the world’s most influential brands, Kavya found herself facing burnout, chronic stress, anxiety, and depression. She discovered the transformative power of the breath to regulate emotions, release stored trauma, and reconnect to a sense of inner balance. Today, she holds space for others on their healing journeys, helping them access the power of the breath to heal, grow, and rediscover their authentic selves.

Need something practical, engaging, and truly uplifting?Join this transformative, activity-driven stress management workshop at MyBoTree, led by Meenakshi R Singh — Emotional Well-Being Consultant, Certified Happiness Life Coach, and Founder of The Uplifting Life Coach.🌿 From calming art and focus-building puzzles to insightful worksheets and guided reflections — walk away with practical tools to calm the chaos and build clarity.

location.address: 85, 2nd Main Rd, next to Barbeque Nation, 1st Block Koramangala, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560034, India

organizer.name: The Uplifting Life Coach
organizer.description: At The Uplifting Life Coach, emotional well-being is reimagined—through action-driven coaching, counseling, consulting, and activity-rich workshops. Based in Bangalore | Uplifting lives across India & globally—for individuals, workplaces, classrooms, and communities.

name: Sunday Breakfast with Strangers
description: Sunday Breakfast with StrangersSlow mornings. Soulful conversations. Delicious vegan food.Step into a space where strangers come together — not for networking, but for meaningful connection over a shared table.This isn’t about small talk. It’s about real people, real stories, and the joy of discovering something new — in someone else or even in yourself.Whether you're here for the food, the company, or simply a pause from the usual Sunday routine, there's a seat waiting for you.Arrive with an open mind, a big appetite, and zero expectations — leave with a full heart.

location.address: 2212, 80 Feet Rd, HAL 3rd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560008, India

organizer.name: HighTable
organizer.description: HighTable is a unique social experience where you get to dine with 4-10 people and engage in meaningful conversations. Our tables create the perfect setting to expand your social circle, and build real connections. If you love good conversations with like-minded people, HighTable is for you!

name: Movie Under the Stars | Sleepless in Seattle
description: Join us for an open-air screening of Sleepless in Seattle (1993), with a three-course dinner by Chef Rhea Aaron and popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movie:Join us for a cozy evening under the stars with Sleepless in Seattle, a timeless romantic classic that reminds us that love often finds us when we least expect it.The film follows Sam, a widowed father whose heartfelt radio call about missing his late wife captures hearts across the country, including that of Annie, a journalist listening on the other side. What unfolds is a story about fate, timing, and a love that spans cities and airwaves.Paired with a thoughtfully curated three-course dinner by Chef Rhea Aaron inspired by the movie’s gentle nostalgia and quiet romance, this is a night made for slow conversations, shared plates, and a little cinematic magic under the night sky. 3-course dinner by Chef Rhea AaronCourse 1:Tomato, Mozzarella, BruschettaCourse 2:Chicken Skewers with Chimichuri, served with smashed baby potatoes and a fresh garden saladORRoasted Cauliflower and Chickpea curry with herbed couscousCourse 3Baked Apple Crumble with Vanilla Custard______Terms and ConditionsThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Limited Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Soju & Slurp
description: Spicy. Fizzy. Loud. Warm.That’s how a Sunday afternoon should feel — and that’s exactly what Soju & Slurp delivers.Hosted from the comfort of our home in Bangalore, this is a 7-seat-only Korean dining experience for those who love discovering new flavors, meeting interesting people, and sipping on craft soju cocktails while slurping bowls of soul-warming food. Whether you come with a friend or show up solo, there’s always room at the table for good vibes.Here’s what to expect:🥢 A fully vegetarian Korean spread — thoughtfully curated and entirely homemade🍲 Tteokbokki (chewy rice cakes in a spicy sauce), braised tofu, and a medley of banchan (Korean side dishes)🍣 Kimbap rolls filled with colorful, crunchy, umami-packed ingredients🍹 Korean-style soju cocktails — light, fun, and perfectly paired with the food✨ Interactive dining — we share stories, swap bites, and maybe even a few soju-induced laughs🌿 Served in a cozy home setting where every dish, every seat, and every guest mattersWhat makes it special?Unlike dining at a restaurant, Soju & Slurp is personal and intimate. You’re not just eating — you’re experiencing a slice of Korean culture through vegetarian comfort food, warm hosting, and a space that feels like a lunch party with new friends. No repeats, no mass cooking — every batch is fresh, and every table is one-of-a-kind.📍 Location: Bangalore⏰ Time: Sunday, 12:30 PM🎟️ Spots: Only 7 seatsCome hungry. Leave happy. Maybe a little tipsy.This is KoreaToIndia’s signature experience, and we can’t wait to have you at our table!

location.address: 274, 11th B Cross Rd, Jeewan Griha Colony, 2nd Phase, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078, India

organizer.name: koreatoindia
organizer.description: koreatoindia is a vegetarian-only supper club reimagining Korean classics through an Indian lens. Founded by Simran, each intimate dining experience is designed to surprise even the most skeptical carnivores. Come for the food. Stay for the stories. Leave plotting your next visit.

name: Letters To Strangers
description: In a world of quick replies and seen ticks, this is a return to something slower, simpler, and more human.Join us for a casual meetup where we’ll write handwritten letters — not to friends you already know, but to strangers across the table. Through gentle prompts, you’ll write from the heart: reflections, questions, memories, or a moment captured in ink.What to Expect:📝 Prompts, not pressure. You’ll be gently guided to write.📓 Paper, Pen & Presence. We’re keeping it analogue — no digital devices.✨ Quiet company and a warm, welcoming space as you write.Come for the writing, stay for the connection.Please note: We may share photos and videos of the event on social media to celebrate the joy and courage in the room.Thank you for being part of the story.

description: Sabha x Luru Monsoon Edit Presents: Pasha Bhai & Demixx Beats (Clan Bokka Phod)Get ready to ignite your senses this monsoon, Bengaluru! Urbanaut, in collaboration with Sabha x Luru Monsoon Edit, is thrilled to bring you an electrifying night of pure, unadulterated energy with Pasha Bhai performing live, alongside the dynamic Demixx Beats, both representing the iconic Clan Bokka Phod!Prepare for an immersive musical experience as these incredible artists take the stage. Whether you're a long-time fan of Clan Bokka Phod or looking for an exhilarating live music experience, this event is designed to thrill.Tickets are limited and expected to sell out fast! Secure your spot now and join us for a crazy show that will leave you wanting more.

name: Healing Journey
description: A table for the hearts that are still mending.Heartbreaks. Burnouts. Breakups. Letting go. Starting over.The conversations we rarely have — but deeply need.Healing Journey is a space to pause, reflect, and feel understood.Come share your story, or simply listen.No pressure. No expectations. Just presence, warmth, and strangers who somehow feel familiar.Because sometimes, healing begins with being heard — over coffee and connection.

name: The Ramen Map Pop-Up
description: Bento Bento presents: The Ramen Map – A Regional Ramen Experience by Chef AnumitraJoin us on July 19th, as Bento Bento launches The Ramen Map — a limited-time ramen-led dining experience celebrating Japan’s regional noodle culture. Curated by the acclaimed Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, the menu explores four distinct ramen styles, each rooted in a specific part of Japan and its culinary philosophy.Expect a deep dive into process, purpose, and provenance — with bowls ranging from temple-inspired vegan ramen to the rich tonkotsu classics of Hakata. This is ramen as it's meant to be: soulful, seasonal, and full of stories.🍜 The Ramen Map is here.One night. Four bowls. Four journeys across Japan.Bento Bento presents an exclusive ramen experience curated by Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, known for her fearless and deeply researched East Asian cooking. From Kyoto’s vegan temple cuisine to the street-smart brothless Mazemen, each bowl is rooted in regional tradition — and reinterpreted for the Bangalore monsoon.Each bowl on this special menu is inspired by a region of Japan and its unique ramen style. From temple kitchens to snowy alleys to post-war Tokyo innovations—every dish has a story.1. Temple Ramen – Kyoto (Vegan) Rooted in the centuries-old traditions of shōjin ryōri—Buddhist temple cuisine—this is a serene, vegan ramen crafted to reflect Kyoto’s spiritual and seasonal sensitivity. The broth is layered with fermented elements, seaweed, and umami-rich ingredients, offering complexity without any animal products. A meditative, almost sacred bowl designed for Bangalore’s vegetarian community.2. Tonkotsu Ramen – Hakata, Kyushu (Pork) From Japan’s southern island comes the quintessential street ramen. The tonkotsu broth, slow-simmered for hours from pork bones, is intensely creamy and collagen-rich. Topped with chashu pork, black garlic oil, and thin Hakata-style noodles, this bowl is deeply satisfying and bold—a nod to the high-energy ramen stalls of Fukuoka.3. Miso Ramen – Sapporo, Hokkaido (Chicken) Cold winters demand warm bowls. This ramen, inspired by Sapporo’s classic miso version, is made with a chicken and soy base fortified with miso paste. Finished with charred corn, sautéed bean sprouts, soft-boiled egg, and grilled chicken, this comforting bowl is perfect for monsoon days in Bangalore.4. Mazemen – Kyoto x Nagoya x Chef’s Remix (Brothless) Mazemen is ramen without broth but with double the intensity. Thick noodles are tossed in soy tare, chili oil, pickled vegetables, and sharp aromatics. While inspired by Kyoto’s simplicity and Nagoya’s street-savvy flair, Chef Anumitra’s version introduces her own cross-regional playfulness. A dish for those who enjoy texture and punch.SIDES & ADD-ONSTo round off the meal, Bento Bento will also offer a line-up of Japanese small plates designed to accompany the ramen bowls:Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Vegan): Cucumber, carrot, wakame seaweedCorn & Radish Leaf Onigiri: Lightly grilled rice ballsAssorted Vegetable Tempura: Served with tentsuyu dipping sauceNon-Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Seafood): Crabsticks, wakame, cucumber, carrotPrawn Tempura: Light and crisp with wasabi mayoChicken Nanban: Fried chicken glazed in tangy sauce, served with tartarDessertDorayaki: Classic Japanese pancake sandwich with sweet red bean filling—a nostalgic Tokyo street snack WHY THIS MATTERS NOWAs Bangalore’s food scene becomes increasingly global, ramen has emerged as a city-wide obsession. But few know the regional soul behind these bowls. The Ramen Map aims to offer context—not just carbs. It’s for eaters who care about origin, for diners seeking more than just trend.It’s also a celebration of cross-cultural cooking—of how Japanese food, when done right, can be soulful and satisfying in the Indian context. Come slurp your way through Japan.Limited seats | 📅 June 19 |

It’s for eaters who care about origin, for diners seeking more than just trend.It’s also a celebration of cross-cultural cooking—of how Japanese food, when done right, can be soulful and satisfying in the Indian context. Come slurp your way through Japan.Limited seats | 📅 June 19 |

name: The Ramen Map Pop-Up
description: Bento Bento presents: The Ramen Map – A Regional Ramen Experience by Chef AnumitraJoin us on July 19th, as Bento Bento launches The Ramen Map — a limited-time ramen-led dining experience celebrating Japan’s regional noodle culture. Curated by the acclaimed Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, the menu explores four distinct ramen styles, each rooted in a specific part of Japan and its culinary philosophy.Expect a deep dive into process, purpose, and provenance — with bowls ranging from temple-inspired vegan ramen to the rich tonkotsu classics of Hakata. This is ramen as it's meant to be: soulful, seasonal, and full of stories.🍜 The Ramen Map is here.One night. Four bowls. Four journeys across Japan.Bento Bento presents an exclusive ramen experience curated by Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, known for her fearless and deeply researched East Asian cooking. From Kyoto’s vegan temple cuisine to the street-smart brothless Mazemen, each bowl is rooted in regional tradition — and reinterpreted for the Bangalore monsoon.Each bowl on this special menu is inspired by a region of Japan and its unique ramen style. From temple kitchens to snowy alleys to post-war Tokyo innovations—every dish has a story.1. Temple Ramen – Kyoto (Vegan) Rooted in the centuries-old traditions of shōjin ryōri—Buddhist temple cuisine—this is a serene, vegan ramen crafted to reflect Kyoto’s spiritual and seasonal sensitivity. The broth is layered with fermented elements, seaweed, and umami-rich ingredients, offering complexity without any animal products. A meditative, almost sacred bowl designed for Bangalore’s vegetarian community.2. Tonkotsu Ramen – Hakata, Kyushu (Pork) From Japan’s southern island comes the quintessential street ramen. The tonkotsu broth, slow-simmered for hours from pork bones, is intensely creamy and collagen-rich. Topped with chashu pork, black garlic oil, and thin Hakata-style noodles, this bowl is deeply satisfying and bold—a nod to the high-energy ramen stalls of Fukuoka.3. Miso Ramen – Sapporo, Hokkaido (Chicken) Cold winters demand warm bowls. This ramen, inspired by Sapporo’s classic miso version, is made with a chicken and soy base fortified with miso paste. Finished with charred corn, sautéed bean sprouts, soft-boiled egg, and grilled chicken, this comforting bowl is perfect for monsoon days in Bangalore.4. Mazemen – Kyoto x Nagoya x Chef’s Remix (Brothless) Mazemen is ramen without broth but with double the intensity. Thick noodles are tossed in soy tare, chili oil, pickled vegetables, and sharp aromatics. While inspired by Kyoto’s simplicity and Nagoya’s street-savvy flair, Chef Anumitra’s version introduces her own cross-regional playfulness. A dish for those who enjoy texture and punch.SIDES & ADD-ONSTo round off the meal, Bento Bento will also offer a line-up of Japanese small plates designed to accompany the ramen bowls:Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Vegan): Cucumber, carrot, wakame seaweedCorn & Radish Leaf Onigiri: Lightly grilled rice ballsAssorted Vegetable Tempura: Served with tentsuyu dipping sauceNon-Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Seafood): Crabsticks, wakame, cucumber, carrotPrawn Tempura: Light and crisp with wasabi mayoChicken Nanban: Fried chicken glazed in tangy sauce, served with tartarDessertDorayaki: Classic Japanese pancake sandwich with sweet red bean filling—a nostalgic Tokyo street snack WHY THIS MATTERS NOWAs Bangalore’s food scene becomes increasingly global, ramen has emerged as a city-wide obsession. But few know the regional soul behind these bowls. The Ramen Map aims to offer context—not just carbs. It’s for eaters who care about origin, for diners seeking more than just trend.It’s also a celebration of cross-cultural cooking—of how Japanese food, when done right, can be soulful and satisfying in the Indian context. Come slurp your way through Japan.Limited seats | 📅 June 19 |

name: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma
description: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma A Mohiniyattam Recital by Amith K.This Mohiniyattam recital by Amith K is a tribute to the hereditary dancer Thottasshery Chinnammu Amma, whose name has nearly disappeared from public memory. The pieces presented are learned from Kalamandalam Chandrika, a direct disciple of Chinnammu Amma, and are carried through the embodied memories of two women dancers.Rooted in tradition yet deeply personal, this performance honors a forgotten lineage in Mohiniyattam. It brings visibility to Chinnammu Amma’s legacy while also acknowledging the continued influence of Amith’s teachers, Nirmala Paniker and Kalamandalam Chandrika. Through this recital, Amith opens a space to reflect on the form’s history, memory, and transmission.Vocal: Rohith AneeshNattuvangam: Sreenima N P.Amith K.Amith K is a scholar, dancer, and choreographer with a PhD from Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady. His work explores the intersections of caste, culture, and history in modern Kerala, with writings on gender, dance, and society. Through Mohiniyattam, he challenges hierarchies within the art world, blending scholarship and performance.

description: Not every gathering needs to be a formal workshop! Our Casual Fold & Connect Nights are all about relaxed creativity, sharing, and building community through Origami. description: Note: this time, Baithak will be held on a Sunday morning.About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. name: Samyoga: Khayal se Kriti tak (unplugged)
description: Samyoga – Khayal Se Kriti TakA unique confluence of Hindustani and Carnatic musical traditionsSamyoga – meaning union or coming together – is an evocative musical production that intricately weaves together the rich threads of India’s two great classical traditions: Hindustani and Carnatic music. Conceptualised and presented by Dr. Radhika Joshi (Hindustani Vocal) and Manasi Prasad (Carnatic Vocal), Samyoga is a celebration of both the shared roots and the distinctive aesthetics of these traditions. This presentation of Samyoga will be an unplugged, voice-only exploration, where two voices come together, accompanied by live tanpuras to create an immersive and meditative musical experience.Traversing the expanse of Indian music, the concert explores genres ranging from the gravitas of classical forms to the devotional depth of Bhakti Sangeet, and from the emotive beauty of Thumri and Jawali to the dramatic expressiveness of Natyasangeet. Each piece is carefully curated to highlight both the convergence and divergence in approach, structure, and emotion across the two systems.Through a seamless blend of performance and narration, Samyoga offers audiences more than just a concert—it presents a musical journey, providing insights into the evolution, nuances, and interconnections between genres. Interestingly, both Radhika and Manasi are alumni of the Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore, who chose to follow their hearts into the world of music. Today, they are recognised not only as accomplished performers but also as dedicated researchers in the field of Indian music.

name: Mapping Your Inner Compass: Freedom & Belonging
description: At different points in life, we often feel pulled in many directions.The desire for freedom and independence.The longing to belong and connect.The quiet inner nudge to grow, shift, or heal.In this reflective Zuva Life experience, guided by master practitioner Ragini Rao (Infinum Growth), we’ll gently explore these three lifelong forces—Autonomy, Homonomy, and Physis—through Transactional Analysis.Ragini Rao is a Teaching and Supervising Transactional Analyst TSTA(P). She trains and supervises advanced training groups in Transactional Analysis to become Psychotherapists, Coaches and Trainers. With over 5000 hours of one-on-one and group counselling and therapy, over a span of 30 years, she has addressed problems pertaining to Relationships, Marital Issues, Depression, Grief, Low Self Esteem and Sexual, Verbal and Physical Abuse.  Ragini is also a licensed workshop leader for the “Heal your Life” programs based on the philosophy of world renowned author Louise L. Hay. She conducts the Heal Your Life workshops in offline settings.Expect a mix of personal reflection, creative expression, group conversations, and playful tools that help you notice:When do I crave independence?Where do I feel most connected to others?What parts of me are ready to grow or change?This isn’t about fixing or solving anything. It’s about pausing, noticing, and gently mapping your own “tug of three.”No prior experience with Transactional Analysis needed—just bring your curiosity.
